projects.description: Tim's Overhead doors is a local garage door company who needed a small website. One of the requirements for the project was to have a contact form with specific form fields. This was accomplished with emailJS and sendinblue. Also there is a photo gallery of their work which uses the Flickr api so the customer can easily add their own images.
Student Directory was built with vanilla Javascript, using static data. There is pagination controlling how long the page is. Also filtering so you can easily search for a student.
This interactive form uses javascript to validate data and uses logic to help the user from making errors before submiting. Also hides and shows content depending on which option is selected.

The game show app using object oriented programming give the user a fun game right in the browser. A random phrase is selected when the game starts the users then selects letters to reveal them in the phrase or lose a life.

Similar to the student directory project, but instead of static content the users are fetcehed from an API. Also you can select a single employee to see more information from them. Using navigation on the modal window to go the next or previous employee.
This JavaScript project picks a random quote from an array and displays it, as well as a random background color. The quotes are also changed automatically within a couple seconds.
